intro: Blakwellia tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly blakwellia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy regions. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is a notable species in Australian flora.
